byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and LILIA BLAISE
byline.contributor: Martin de Bourmont contributed reporting from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The court ruled that the prohibition in Villeneuve-Loubet violated civil liberties, in a warning that could affect other communities that have banned the swimwear.

headline.print_headline: French Town’s Ban of ‘Burkini’ Violates Rights, a Court Rules
headline.main: Court Overturns ‘Burkini’ Ban in French Town

snippet: The court ruled that the prohibition in Villeneuve-Loubet violated civil liberties, in a warning that could affect other communities that have banned the swimwear....
abstract: France's highest administrative court overturns town of Villeneuve-Loubet's ban on burkinis, full-body swimwear donned by some Muslim women; ruling establishes precedent challenging similar bans in least 30 other towns, most of them on French Riviera.
